intro: Hieracium rebildense, commonly known as the Rebild hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, particularly found in meadows and grasslands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium rebildense is often considered a weed in agricultural areas due to its aggressive growth habit.
